name: Open Terms Archive
description: Open Terms Archive publicly records every version of the terms of digital services to enable democratic oversight.

sdg: SDG16: Peace¸ Justice and Strong Institutions
sdgs.relevance:
SDG 16 - Peace, Justice and Strong Institutions: Open Terms Archive empowers citizens, civil society, regulators, and lawmakers to hold digital platforms accountable. This fosters:
• democratic processes resilience by reinforcing protection against mis- and disinformation, as evidenced in the 2022 French elections: https://www.reset.tech/resources/memos-on-platforms-behaviour-during-the-2022-french-elections/
• compliance with laws and regulations, as evidenced by the European Commission using Open Terms Archive to collect data for assessing the implementation of the platforms-to-businesses (“P2B” / 2019/1150) regulation
• situational awareness for regulators, as evidenced by the usage of Open Terms Archive data by the French Ministry for Foreign Affairs and the French Department of Expertise in Digital Regulation.

SDG 17 - Partnerships for the Goals: Open Terms Archive actively seeks and facilitates collaborations with various stakeholders, including regulators, press and media, consumer protection associations… These partnerships aim at sharing all their capabilities to achieve a common goal: a more transparent, accountable, and just digital environment. For example:
• The French Ministry for Foreign Affairs leveraging data collected by the German Universität Bremen.
• The Swiss NGO HestiaLabs.ai collaborating with French consumer protection association UFC-QueChoisir following their common contributions to Open Terms Archive.
• American NGO Reset.tech providing data to researchers around the world through Open Terms Archive: https://www.reset.tech/resources/memos-on-platforms-behaviour-during-the-2022-french-elections/
• American members of Congress using joint achievements of the ToS;DR NGO and Open Terms Archive in Europe to support domestic legislation mandating more transparency in terms of use: https://trahan.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=2353

SDG 9 - Industry, Innovation, and Infrastructure: Open Terms Archive ensures accountability and transparency in digital infrastructure and digital service providers. While digital tools and digital infrastructure constitute an increasingly large part of development efforts, the terms offered by providers vary widely across jurisdictions. Open Terms Archive enables time-based as well as jurisdiction-based difference tracking, meaning it can show the difference between the terms offered by providers in varying countries. It also facilitates ensuring compliance by tracking changes following the enactment of legislation. For example, when the Malabo Convention on Cybersecurity and Personal Data Protection will be ratified within the African Union, authorities and civil society will be able to check which private actors comply within the 30 days window that will be provided to them.

NonPII.nonPIIAccessMechanism:
All the data collected by Open Terms Archive consists of publicly available terms of services.
They are stored by default on the filesystem in HTML and Markdown format, and can be accessed directly on the filesystem or through the JavaScript API exposed by the engine.
Optional adapters can be developed by contributors to interact with other database formats.

userContent.contentManagement: Content is collected stored and distributed.
userContent.contentManagementPolicy:
Every contribution to track a document is reviewed a priori by a well-identified collection maintainer.
Until the review has been done, no content is collected, stored nor distributed.
As Open Terms Archive is decentralised, each collection maintainer sets its own standards, processes and delays for review.
